00001 /*********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         lrs1821.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Cotents:      Routines for accessing Fastbus over LeCroy 1821 SMI
00007                 under MS-DOS via the 1691A IBM-PC interface.
00008                 
00009   $Log: lrs1821.c,v $
00010   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:07  mucap
00011   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00012   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00013 
00014   Revision 1.2  2004/01/08 08:40:08  midas

00036 static struct {
00037    WORD addr;
00038    char data[17];
00039 } patch_table[] = {
00040 
00041    0x34, "c00400000708",        // ECL OUT1=1
00042        0x35, "c00400000308",    // ECL OUT1=0
00043        0x36, "800401020000",    // load pdreg=01
00044        0x37, "830400000000",    // test IN1
00045        0x38, "a3043a000000",    // return if IN1 on
00046        0x39, "800400020000",    // load pdreg=00
00047        0x3a, "c00400", 0x40, "800000080000",    // Hardware block transfer
00048        0x41, "80040000023f", 0x42, "85b400020200", 0x43, "a5b443040301", 0x44, "807700000e20", 0x45, "a5874a000f01", 0x46, "a07745000a00", 0x47, "850400000301", 0x48, "d0047a00021f", 0x49, "c00400000000", 0x4a, "80041e020000", 0x4b, "c58440000301", 0x7a, "819400028609", 0, "",   // end marker
00049 };

00052 
00053 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00054 static HANDLE _hdio = 0;
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 int fb_init(void)
00058 /*********************************************************************
00059 * Initialize Fastbus including 1821 and 1691                         *
00060 *********************************************************************/
00061 {
00062    WORD status, version, update, i, data, addr;
00063    char *pc, str[4];
00064 
00065 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00066    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
00067    DWORD buffer[] = { 6, BASE_1691, BASE_1691 + 18, 0 };
00068    DWORD size;
00069 
00070    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
00071    GetVersionEx(&vi);
00072 
00073    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
00074    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
00075       _hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00076                          OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00077       if (_hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00078          return -1;
00079    }
00080 
00081    if (!DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00082                         NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00083       return -1;
00084 #endif                          /* _MSC_VER */
00085 
00086    // set 1821 front panel address
00087    OUTP(RCL, BYPASS + 0);
00088 
00089    // clear registers
00090    OUTWR(REG0, 0);
00091    OUTWR(REG1, 0);
00092    OUTWR(REG2, 0);
00093    OUTWR(REG3, 0);
00094    OUTWR(REG4, 0);
00095    OUTWR(REG5, 0);
00096    OUTWR(REG6, 0);
00097    OUTWR(REG7, 0);
00098 
00099    // Check communication
00100    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET);
00101    status = INPW(REG3);
00102    if (status != _RESET) {
00103       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Cannot access 1821. Check power and cabling.");
00104       return FALSE;
00105    }
00106    // Check Fastbus power
00107    status = INPW(REG7);
00108    if (!(status & PWR_1) || !(status & PWR_2)) {
00109       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Fastbus power test failed. Check power and cabling.");
00110       return FALSE;
00111    }
00112    // Load ROM to sequencer
00113    OUTWR(REG0, PD_PMAR_TO_SEQ | PA_MENU_TO_SEQ | PLOAD + ROM_NO);
00114    OUTWR(REG7, PMADZ | PMADL);
00115 
00116    Sleep(10);
00117    while (INPW(REG7) & ACTIVE);
00118 
00119    // check version of PROM
00120    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_MENU_TO_HOST + ROM_NO);
00121 
00122    OUTWR(REG1, ROM_VER);        // Address of version #
00123    version = INPW(REG2) & 0xFF;
00124 
00125    OUTWR(REG1, ROM_UPD);        // Address of update #
00126    update = INPW(REG2) & 0xFF;
00127 
00128    if (version != 6 && version != 7)
00129       fprintf(stderr, "fb_init: Unkown PROM version %d.%d.\n", version, update);
00130 
00131    // load patch table
00132    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_HOST_TO_SEQ | PLOAD);
00133    for (i = 0; patch_table[i].addr > 0; i++) {
00134       pc = patch_table[i].data;
00135       addr = patch_table[i].addr * 8;
00136       do {
00137          if (isxdigit(*pc) && isxdigit(*(pc + 1))) {
00138             str[0] = *pc;
00139             str[1] = *(pc + 1);
00140             str[2] = 0;
00141             sscanf(str, "%X", &data);
00142 
00143             OUTWR(REG1, addr);
00144             OUTWR(REG2, data);
00145             OUTWR(REG7, SQWRT);
00146          }
00147          pc += 2;
00148          addr++;
00149       } while (*pc);
00150    }
00151 
00152    // ignite the sequencer
00153    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_HOST_TO_SEQ | PLOAD);
00154    OUTWR(REG1, IDLE);
00155    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_HOST_TO_SEQ);
00156 
00157    // clear all fastbus lines
00158    fb_exec(FPCLBS);
00159 
00160    // set arbitration level
00161    OUTWR(REG2, ARB_LEVEL);
00162    fb_exec(FBARB);
00163 
00164    // reset bus
00165    fb_exec(FPRBUS);
00166 
00167    // request mastership
00168    fb_exec(FPREQ);
00169 
00170    return SUCCESS;
00171 }
00172 
00173 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00174 
00175 void fb_exit(void)
00176 {
00177    // release mastership
00178    fb_exec(FPREL);
00179 
00180 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00181    {
00182       DWORD buffer[] = { 6, BASE_1691, BASE_1691 + 18, 0 };
00183       DWORD size;
00184 
00185       if (_hdio <= 0)
00186          return;
00187 
00188       DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00189                       NULL, 0, &size, NULL);
00190    }
00191 #endif
00192 }
00193 
00194 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00195 
00196 int fb_reset(void)
00197 {
00198    // reset bus
00199    return fb_exec(FPRBUS);
00200 }

00202 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00203 
00204 void fb_write_data_memory(WORD * buffer, WORD count)
00205 /*********************************************************************
00206 * Write 'count' words to 1821 data memory from 'buffer'              *
00207 *********************************************************************/
00208 {
00209    int i, j;
00210 
00211    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | DMB_HOST_TO_DMEM);
00212    OUTWR(REG6, EAUTO | UP + 0);
00213    OUTWR(REG7, DMARL);
00214 
00215    for (i = 0, j = 0; i < count / 2; i++) {
00216       OUTWR(REG4, buffer[j]);
00217       j++;
00218       OUTWR(REG5, buffer[j]);
00219       j++;
00220 
00221       OUTWR(REG7, DMWRT);
00222    }
00223 }
00224 
00225 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00226 
00227 void fb_read_data_memory(DWORD * data, int count)
00228 /*********************************************************************
00229 * Read 'count' words to 1821 data memory from 'buffer'               *
00230 *********************************************************************/
00231 {
00232    WORD *p, i;
00233 
00234    if (count == 0)
00235       return;
00236 
00237    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MUXR0 | DMB_DMEM_TO_HOST);
00238    OUTWR(REG6, EAUTO | UP | EGIP5 + 0);
00239    OUTWR(REG7, DMARL);
00240 
00241    p = (WORD *) data;
00242 
00243    for (i = 0; i < count / 2; i++)
00244       *p++ = INPW(REG4);
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00248 
00249 BOOL fb_exec(WORD location)
00250 /*********************************************************************
00251 * Execute sequencer function at "location" in 1821                   *
00252 *********************************************************************/
00253 {
00254    int i;
00255 
00256    OUTWR(REG1, location * 8);
00257    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00258 
00259    // check if sequencer executed start, ~100 us timeout
00260    for (i = 100; (INPW(REG7) & IWARDY) && i > 0; i--);
00261    if (i == 0) {
00262       fprintf(stderr, "fb_exec: sequencer timeout.\n");
00263       return (FALSE);
00264    }
00265    return (TRUE);
00266 }
00267 
00268 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00269 
00270 BOOL fb_load32(DWORD data)
00271 /*********************************************************************
00272 * Load a 32-bit data word to the sequencer. Used in read/write fast- *
00273 * bus cycles.                                                        *
00274 *********************************************************************/
00275 {
00276    OUTWR(REG2, (WORD) data);
00277    if (!fb_exec(LD_LOW))
00278       return (FALSE);
00279 
00280    OUTWR(REG2, (WORD) (data >> 16));
00281    if (!fb_exec(LD_HIGH))
00282       return (FALSE);
00283 
00284    return (TRUE);
00285 
00286 }

00288 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00289 
00290 int fb_frd(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data)
00291 /* read data space */
00292 {
00293    // primary address cycle to data space
00294    OUTWR(REG2, paddr);
00295    OUTWR(REG1, FPAD * 8);
00296    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00297 
00298    // Seconadry address write cycle
00299    fb_load32(saddr);
00300    fb_exec(FPWNTA);
00301 
00302    // no pedestal subtraction, reg. 4 & 5 dest of ped.subr.subsyst. output
00303    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MWENB | DMB_PED_TO_HOST);
00304 
00305    // no auto advance due to read
00306    OUTWR(REG6, 0);
00307 
00308    // data memory addr load from reg. 6
00309    OUTWR(REG7, DMARL);
00310 
00311    if (!fb_exec(FPR))
00312       return FALSE;
00313 
00314    ((WORD *) data)[0] = INPW(REG4);
00315    ((WORD *) data)[1] = INPW(REG5);
00316 
00317    return SUCCESS;
00318 }
00319 
00320 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00321 
00322 int fb_frc(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data)
00323 /* read control space */
00324 {
00325    // primary address cycle to control space
00326    OUTWR(REG2, paddr);
00327    OUTWR(REG1, FPAC * 8);
00328    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00329 
00330    // Seconadry address write cycle
00331    fb_load32(saddr);
00332    fb_exec(FPWNTA);
00333 
00334    // no pedestal subtraction, reg. 4 & 5 dest of ped.subr.subsyst. output
00335    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MWENB | DMB_PED_TO_HOST);
00336 
00337    // no auto advance due to read
00338    OUTWR(REG6, 0);
00339 
00340    // data memory addr load from reg. 6
00341    OUTWR(REG7, DMARL);
00342 
00343    if (!fb_exec(FPR))
00344       return FALSE;
00345 
00346    ((WORD *) data)[0] = INPW(REG4);
00347    ((WORD *) data)[1] = INPW(REG5);
00348 
00349    return TRUE;
00350 }

00353 
00354 int fb_fwd(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00355 {
00356    // primary address cycle to data space
00357    OUTWR(REG2, paddr);
00358    OUTWR(REG1, FPAC * 8);
00359    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00360 
00361    // Seconadry address write cycle
00362    fb_load32(saddr);
00363    fb_exec(FPWNTA);
00364 
00365    fb_load32(data);
00366    return (fb_exec(FPW));
00367 }

00371 int fb_fwc(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00372 {
00373    // primary address cycle to control space
00374    OUTWR(REG2, paddr);
00375    OUTWR(REG1, FPAC * 8);
00376    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00377 
00378    // Seconadry address write cycle
00379    fb_load32(saddr);
00380    fb_exec(FPWNTA);
00381 
00382    fb_load32(data);
00383    return (fb_exec(FPW));
00384 }

00400 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00401 
00402 BOOL fb_frdb(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data, int *count)
00403 /*********************************************************************
00404 * Execute a FASTBUS block read into 1821 internal memory.            *
00405 *********************************************************************/
00406 {
00407    int i;
00408 
00409    // primary address cycle to data space
00410    OUTWR(REG2, paddr);
00411    OUTWR(REG1, FPAD * 8);
00412    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00413 
00414    // Seconadry address write cycle
00415    fb_load32(saddr);
00416    fb_exec(FPWNTA);
00417 
00418    // no pedestal subtraction, reg. 4 & 5 dest of ped.subr.subsyst. output
00419    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MWENB | DMB_PED_TO_HOST);
00420 
00421    // Configure 1821
00422    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MWENB | DMB_PED_TO_DMEM);       // no pedestal subtraction
00423 //  OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | MWENB | DMB_PED_TO_DMEM | PDMSUB | SUPRNEG | SUPRZERO);
00424    OUTWR(REG6, EAUTO | UP + 0); // start at zero
00425    OUTWR(REG7, DMARL);
00426 
00427 //  OUTWR(REG1, USER);
00428 //  OUTWR(REG1, HDRBL);
00429    OUTWR(REG1, FPRBL * 8);      // FPRBL for non-LeCroy modules (slower)
00430    OUTWR(REG7, GO);
00431 
00432    // wait for 1821 to complete, ~200 us timeout
00433    for (i = 200; (INPW(REG7) & (IWARDY | ACTIVE)) && i > 0; i--);
00434 
00435    if (i == 0) {
00436       fprintf(stderr, "fb_fprbl: block transfer timeout.\n");
00437       return (FALSE);
00438    }
00439    // read status
00440    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_SEQ_TO_HOST);
00441    if (INPW(REG2) != 0x200) {
00442       fprintf(stderr, "fb_fprbl: bad block transfer status.\n");
00443       return (FALSE);
00444    }
00445    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_HOST_TO_SEQ);
00446 
00447    // read dword count
00448    i = (INPW(REG6) & 0xFFF) * sizeof(DWORD);
00449    if (i > *count)
00450       i = *count;
00451    *count = i;
00452 
00453    fb_read_data_memory(data, *count);
00454 
00455    return (TRUE);
00456 }
00457 
00458 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00459 
00460 BOOL fb_ped_load(WORD * data, WORD count, WORD slot, BOOL high)
00461 /*********************************************************************
00462 * Download 'count' pedestal values in 'data' on 'slot'               *
00463 * If 'high'==TRUE, put to the high range pedestal memory.            *
00464 *********************************************************************/
00465 {
00466    int i;
00467    WORD addr;
00468 
00469    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | PDMSEL | DMB_HOST_TO_PED);
00470 
00471    for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00472       addr = (slot << 11) | (high << 7) | i;
00473       OUTWR(REG5, addr);
00474       OUTWR(REG4, data[i]);
00475       OUTWR(REG7, PDMADR);
00476       OUTWR(REG7, PDMWRT);
00477    }
00478 
00479    // verify data
00480    for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00481       OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | PDMSEL | DMB_HOST_TO_PED);
00482       addr = (slot << 11) | (high << 7) | i;
00483       OUTWR(REG5, addr);
00484       OUTWR(REG7, PDMADR);
00485 
00486       OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | PDMSEL | DMB_PED_TO_HOST);
00487       if (INPW(REG4) != data[i]) {
00488          printf("fb_ped_load: pedestal verify error.\n");
00489          return (FALSE);
00490       }
00491    }
00492 
00493    return (TRUE);
00494 }
00495 
00496 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00497 
00498 BOOL fb_thr_load(WORD data, BOOL high)
00499 /*********************************************************************
00500 * Download threshold value                                           *
00501 *********************************************************************/
00502 {
00503    OUTWR(REG3, _RESET | DMB_HOST_TO_PED);
00504    OUTWR(REG5, (high << 7));
00505    OUTWR(REG4, data);
00506    OUTWR(REG7, PDMADR);
00507    OUTWR(REG7, PDCWRT);
00508    return (TRUE);
00509 }

00513 DWORD fb_in()
00514 /*********************************************************************
00515 * Read ECL IN1                                                       *
00516 *********************************************************************/
00517 {
00518    DWORD s;
00519 
00520    fb_exec(IN1TST);
00521 
00522    // read status
00523    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_SEQ_TO_HOST);
00524    s = INPW(REG2);
00525    OUTWR(REG0, PA_HOST_TO_SEQ | PD_HOST_TO_SEQ);
00526 
00527    return s;
00528 }
